name: Cook the Book: Sweet Potatoes Au Gratin
description: This gratin from Lyniece North Talmadge's The Sweet Potato Lover's Cookbook takes chunks of sweet potatoes and bakes them with a mix of cream, thyme, parmesan, and gruyère until molten, bubbly, and brown. It's just as rich and creamy as you'd imagine with a list of ingredients like that, with the cream and cheese melding with the potatoes, creating a custard-like filling, and a top and bottom crust with plenty of browned, scrape-able bits—the tell-tale sign of a great gratin.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the sweet potatoes in a large pot in water to cover for 5 minutes. Drain, cool, peel, and dice into 1-inch pieces. Preheat the oven to 350°. Spray a baking dish with nonstick vegetable spray. Place the sweet potatoes in the dish and season with salt, pepper, and thyme. Mix the cream and cornstarch together and pour over the sweet potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 15 minutes. Brown under the broiler for about 3 minutes.
